intro: Phyllanthus thymoides, commonly known as the Indian false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, which are borne on slender pedicels. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodland or grassland habitats. Phyllanthus thymoides is also noted for its medicinal uses in traditional systems of medicine.
